thread.title: Bare-chested 'Rambo' knifeman is caught on CCTV
thread.title_full: Bare-chested 'Rambo' knifeman is caught on CCTV

title: Bare-chested 'Rambo' knifeman is caught on CCTV
text: Share this article Share The pair then repeatedly lunge and slash at one another in a front garden before moving onto the pavement. At one point Bishop, 40, who can be seen wearing a scarf around his face, falls to the ground as a horrified neighbour tries to intervene. Stoke-on-Trent Crown Court heard the fight happened at about 7.30am on December 7, 2015 in full view of neighbours, reported the Stoke Sentinel. The defendants were sentenced to 20 months in prison last week. Officers released the footage in the hope in would warn others about the potentially fatal consequences of carrying knives. Russell Morris (left) and Alan Bishop (right) were sentenced to 20 months in prison last week after the terrifying knife fight in Stoke A Staffordshire Police spokesman said: 'This is a dispute that clearly got way out of hand. 'We are pleased with the sentence handed down as it shows that assaults using knives will not be tolerated.' Bishop had gone to Morris's flat with a knife because he was unhappy his ex-girlfriend was there. Sentencing the pair, Judge David Fletcher said: 'That sort of behaviour in a place where people live can never be condoned or accepted.' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
